intro: Minuartia anatolica subsp. kabirarum, commonly known as the Anatolian rock-cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
